amendatorysection.catchline: Judgments for fines and costs; execution in another county or against real estate; filing of transcript in district court.
amendatorysection.para: In every case, whenever it is desirable to obtain execution to be issued to another county, or against the lands or real estate of any person against whom a judgment for fine or costs has been rendered by a magistrate, the magistrate may file with the clerk of the district court of the county wherein such magistrate holds office a transcript of the judgment, whereupon such clerk shall enter the cause upon the register of actions and shall file with the clerk of such court a praecipe and execution to be forthwith issued thereon by such clerk and served in all respects as though the judgment had been rendered in the district court of such county.
